p: The Li–DEC coordination breaking and forming dynamics are manifested in the T w- dependent cross peak intensity changes on the 2D infrared spectra. As mentioned earlier, there are three different DEC species in electrolyte solutions that are free DEC, DEC···Li +(DEC) n–1 and DEC···Li +:PF 6 −(DEC) n–2. However, DEC in DEC···Li +(DEC) n–1 and that in DEC···Li +:PF 6 −(DEC) n–2 are neither spectrally nor kinetically resolvable, due to the similarity in solvation structures. This led us to use a simple two-state exchange model between DEC and DEC···Li +(ligands) n–1, where ligand refers to either DEC or PF 6 − and n varies depending on lithium salt concentration and solvent composition. Here the chemical exchange dynamics is therefore the dynamical equilibrium between Li +(ligands) n and Li +(ligands) n–1+free DEC ( Fig. 4a).
